::Spears::

She stayed knealing. "Thank you, My Master.  Thank you for the mercy 
that you have shown."  She got up and looked at Prebon. Then she 
turned and took a few steps closer to the door and looked through it. 
SHe saw Striker. She snapped at him,"That will teach you to show the 
Master some respect. And don't try to leave your cell. If you try 
anything, we are both dead." She smiled evilly and walked back to 
Prebon's side. She looked at Prebon, "Master, I wish to thank you for 
showing your mercy today."  She leaned over and kissed Prebon on the 
cheek.

She thought she was going to be sick as she kissed Prebon.  She 
couldn't believe she was doing this.  But she had to come up with 
something to get Prebon away from Striker so he could try to escape.  
She knew that she would self Destruct if he escaped, but she felt it 
would be worth it if he got away and without that blasted chip.



--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, minime_316@h... wrote:
> Prebon
> 
> Prebon watched Spears beg for this bot. What was so special about 
> him? It didn't matter. In a few days she would be beggin...for me 
to 
> hurt him! But for today he would spare him.
> 
> "Hammer, stop firing.("done boss.") I have shown Mercy today, but 
if 
> he is insolent again, than he will not be so lucky."
> 
> Prebon pressed two buttons on the controls. One drew back the guns 
> into the wall, but the other flipped out a very small spy cam in 
the 
> top corner. The image was broadcasted to Hammer in the main bridge. 
> He turned to Spears.
> 
> "Remember! No aiding him, no giving him anything without his 
> permission. If he tries to escape you will do everything in your 
> power to stop him, and if he still escapes, you will kill yourself 
a 
> mile outside the base. Understand? Good."
> 
> Prebon walked to the main bridge where Hammer was watching Striker 
> through the camera.
> 
> "If he tries anything, kill him. Soon we go for Ramulus."
> 
______________________________________________________________________
> Brix/Fliq
> 
> Brix continued to stare at the group.
> 
> "So who's gonna help me install these computer boards? We won't 
know 
> about the ship without them!"
